resource.chars:
which has a similar action to the saliva of the 
<u>Vertebrata <\u>.
As is well known the salivary glands in the larval 
state secrete the silk-like material in which the 
larvae invest themselves on turning into pupae.
This silk-like material yielded the following 
result on analysis *:
Carbon ... 47.92
Hydrogen ... 6.10
Nitrogen ... 16.89
Oxygen ... 29.09
100.00
It is therefore, allied to fibroin, sericoin, spongin,
and other skeletins.+
* The average of four analyses.
+ See also the papers of Heyl in <u>Berichte der Deutschen Chemis-
chen Gesellschaft <\u>, vol. 21, pp. 1407, 1529; Cramer in <u>Journal der Chemie 
und Pharmacie <\u>, vol 111, p.12; and Zalocostras in <u>Comptes Rendus <\u>,
vol.107. p.252.
